intro: Alloplectus lanatus, commonly known as the hairy bladderpod, is a flowering plant native to North America. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its hairy stems and leaves, as well as its small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its fruit is a pod that contains several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Alloplectus lanatus is often found in dry, disturbed soils and is considered an invasive species in some regions.
